meanings.sent1: She was gentling the scared kitten by speaking softly to it.
meanings.sent2: The mother was gentling her baby to sleep by rocking him gently.
meanings.sent3: The magician's wand seemed to be gentling the fierce lion into a purring kitten.
meanings.sent4: The sun's rays were gentling the harsh winter landscape into a soft, golden glow.
meanings.sent5: The music had a gentling effect on the rowdy crowd, calming them down instantly.

meanings.definition: The act of making something gentle.
meanings.sent1: Her gentling of the wild horse was a true display of patience and care.
meanings.sent2: The gentling of the storm's fury brought a sense of peace to the town.
meanings.sent3: The gentling of the spicy dish with a dollop of cream made it more enjoyable.
meanings.sent4: The gentling of the rough edges on the sculpture gave it a more refined look.
meanings.sent5: The gentling of the harsh criticism with a kind smile made it easier to accept.
